data.name: How long will you be able to breathe ?
data.description:
When you practice diving, you use tanks having a real volume of 12 liters, containing compressed air at a pressure of 200 bars.

- The average air consumption per minute is 15 liters at the surface level.

- The regulator that allows you to breathe delivers air at ambient pressure.

- The ambiant pressure is the sum of the atmospheric pressure (1 bar) and
the relative hydrostatic pressure which increases linearly by one bar every 10 meters.

Write a function how_long(depth) which computes the number of minutes you can stay at a given depth (in meters) before running out of air.

*In this kata, we do not take into account the time required for the descent and ascent, but only the time spent at a constant given depth.*
